page.title: 15CRUDWELL FARM -TYPICAL DAY
page.content: The{farmers}in our area{work long days {and are dependent on the weather.}This account of a typical farm day shows this:Forecast, Sat.July 13th 1985,fine and hot with evening thunderstorms. With{a field of hay to be baled}a hectic day faced the farmers.Milking, feeding and machinery checks were done by 9am.Two trailers were put in position for a man to load with the 400 bales already in the field.The other farmer teds the hay.Baling starts at 1pm,a friend helps to unload and reload the trailers.A neighbour's trailer was commandeered as 7 would be insufficient for the{estimated 1,000 {bales.}Rain started at 7pm but work continued as the bales would be ruined if left in the field.{At 10pm the last {trailer is put under cover}and evening milking and feeding completed.Tea time at last!
